title: Research Scientist Interview
Interview Descriptions: Streamlined and coordinated. HR set up most of the meetings and spoke with them the most frequently. Offer was given promptly and quickly. Interviewed with all members of the lab additionally and privately with lead scientist and PI.
Interview Questions: What is a different approach that you bring to the lab?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wistar Institute (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Friendly atmosphere. They want to make sure you are the good fit for all labs. They ask a few questions. Interview is about 1 hr. Then they give you a tour of the lab.
Interview Questions: What do you know about vaccines?

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Wistar Institute (Phila, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews 1st with HR, Controller and CFO, 2nd with COO, 3rd with HR, Controller and CFO.  The whole process took 90 days.  Went several weeks without any feedback.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to work with Ms access? How would you go about gathering certain database information? What is level of excel skills ?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wistar Institute (Phila, PA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview process. Full day scheduled as follow: 1. Meeting the research group. 2. Presentation. 3.  Lunch with lab members. 4. Meeting with group leader. Overall good experience.
Interview Questions: What percentage of your publication was written by your PI and what percentage was written by yourself?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wistar Institute (New Orleans, LA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were two round of interviews, the first with an immediate supervisor and would-be teammates. This was less formal. The second round was with higher-level management and was more formal, and included preparation of a sample newsletter.
Interview Questions: There was a focus on how I handle conflict resolution and strong personalities.

title: Grants and Contracts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wistar Institute
Interview Descriptions: People seemed to be valued for their unique skill sets and company was presented as an overall decent organization with supportive management staff.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wistar Institute (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Questions: What is your long term goal?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wistar Institute (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Advice to applicants: Definitely read a good deal about the PI and his/her research before going in to the 1:1 interview.
Interview Questions: What do you find most interesting about my research?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wistar Institute (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the lab PI. Asked basic questions about my skills and interests. Nothing unexpected. It was a fairly easy interview process. This is one of the few companies that will sponsor work visas for foreigners.
Interview Questions: Describe you history working in a lab environment.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wistar Institute (Phila, PA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Was called by HR early on and fielded a few questions about my role at the lab I was working at during the time and what my 5-year plan was. I was then offered an interview, and first met with HR, which asked me some basic questions about what I did well vs. what I was weak at; where I saw myself in 5 years; describe a time when I succeeded against the odds/ exhibited leadership initiative.
Interview Questions: "What would your boss say your major weaknesses are?"
